snippet.textDisplay:
THAT is what I wanted from a switch. Now I use a 11.5" convertible tablet with separate dock and removable solid KB (unlike Surface) for retro and indie gaming, with a Dualshock 4 controller. Basically it's a combination of the first 2 devices, but has a desktop dock with dedicated keyboard and mouse. (Samsung ATIV 700t)


There's a lot of room for improvement with the external peripherals in most devices. I can undock the tablet from the dock, open the bag, dock it with the KB and close it and walk out the door. It's just so convenient. A KB that covers the screen is ideal for portable devices.
snippet.textOriginal:
THAT is what I wanted from a switch. Now I use a 11.5" convertible tablet with separate dock and removable solid KB (unlike Surface) for retro and indie gaming, with a Dualshock 4 controller. Basically it's a combination of the first 2 devices, but has a desktop dock with dedicated keyboard and mouse. (Samsung ATIV 700t)


There's a lot of room for improvement with the external peripherals in most devices. I can undock the tablet from the dock, open the bag, dock it with the KB and close it and walk out the door. It's just so convenient. A KB that covers the screen is ideal for portable devices.

snippet.textDisplay: I have a Microsoft Surface and I love it, but honestly the detachable keyboard is less useful that just carrying a small bluetooth keyboard.  I can put my bluetooth board wherever I want -- Surface on the table, keyboard in my lap if I want to.  This PC looks cool, but I think I would prefer a Surface (or any slate) and a separate PS4 controller.  This looks useful for bus rides and absolutely nothing else.
snippet.textOriginal: I have a Microsoft Surface and I love it, but honestly the detachable keyboard is less useful that just carrying a small bluetooth keyboard.  I can put my bluetooth board wherever I want -- Surface on the table, keyboard in my lap if I want to.  This PC looks cool, but I think I would prefer a Surface (or any slate) and a separate PS4 controller.  This looks useful for bus rides and absolutely nothing else.

Protected by US Patent Nos. 9,724,601; 9,751,008; 9,757,647; 9,776,081;

snippet.textDisplay:
@0:14 - 3:11 hell yes thank you @Dell! #projectUFO
Please go forward with this! it's all the hardware of a PC that the PS vita refused to be!
add a user upgrade-able internal WiFi/Bluetooth chip, a internal NVME SSD slot , a micro SD card slot, hardware wan/lan ki77 switches (just like the PS VITA.) and lastly don't lock Linux out of this device. If @Dell can pull this off.... wow i'd break my never pre-order rule so fast!
This would be sick!
snippet.textOriginal:
@0:14 - 3:11 *hell yes* thank you @Dell! #projectUFO 
 Please go forward with this! it's all the hardware of a PC that the PS vita refused to be!
add a user upgrade-able internal WiFi/Bluetooth chip,  a internal  NVME SSD slot , a micro SD card slot, hardware wan/lan ki77 switches  (just like the PS VITA.) and lastly  *don't lock Linux out* of this device.   If @Dell can pull this off.... wow  i'd break my never pre-order rule so fast! 
This would be *sick!*

snippet.textDisplay:
I'll buy one, but only if they change the name. "UFO" is not only hard to say but less memorable than their other product names, and it's far from sounding cool imo. Still excited how it pans out, the integrated graphics use is interesting to me.

The idea of PC games in a handheld is a fever dream though, I've been wanting one of these since I got a DS way back.

It would be hilarious if they released the first iteration and it had the most whiny fan ever, like from a handheld vacuum.

snippet.textDisplay:
"The games are too expensive"

Well you could buy at least 7 Switch games at full new release price for the price difference. Seems like a weak excuse to me lol.

I'd rather have the Dell gaming laptop they showed at CES, which is probably a similar price point. If it's not gonna fit into a pocket, it might as well be useful.

2 hour battery life tho... let's hope they work on that.
snippet.textOriginal:
"The games are too expensive"

I'd rather have the Dell gaming laptop they showed at CES, which is probably a similar price point. If it's not gonna fit into a pocket, it might as well be useful. 

2 hour battery life tho... let's hope they work on that.

snippet.textDisplay:
Hey Dell, here's a suggestion, STOP MAKING CHEAPO GARBAGE HARDWARE IN CHINA AND GIVING IT A 300% MARKUP!
Oh and This "UFO" device is just dumb. No one will buy it, there are far too many inherent flaws with streaming games over wifi. Also, the battery life is abysmal, and there is no reason to use it on the go (unless it runs android, then you have shitty phone games).

Oh and This "UFO" device is just dumb. No one will buy it, there are far too many inherent flaws with streaming games over wifi. Also, the battery life is abysmal, and there is no reason to use it on the go (unless it runs android, then you have shitty phone games).

snippet.textDisplay:
My parents actually got me an Alienware in high school (without my asking for it) and told me it was for school.

Granted it was the barebones X3 (i3@3.2GHz, GeForce GT 640, 220w power supply, all outdated by the time I got it) but I thought it was funny.

I had been telling them I wanted a gaming computer, but I specifically told them I wanted to build one myself... Despite the fact I'd been building (crappy recycled) computers since I was 11, my stepmother thought it was "dangerous" and was against the idea of giving me an allowance so that I could earn money to buy top of the line parts and build one myself.
snippet.textOriginal:
My parents actually got me an Alienware in high school (without my asking for it) and told me it was for school.

Granted it was the barebones X3 (i3@3.2GHz, GeForce GT 640, 220w power supply, all outdated by the time I got it) but I thought it was funny.

I had been telling them I wanted a gaming computer, but I specifically told them I wanted to build one myself... Despite the fact I'd been building (crappy recycled) computers since I was 11, my stepmother thought it was "dangerous" and was against the idea of giving me an allowance so that I could earn money to buy top of the line parts and build one myself.

snippet.textDisplay:
This would be great! But it has to be at a reasonable price range, good battery life, and strong Wi-Fi antenna (considering a lot of PC gamers are probably going to use this, they can stream gameplay from their PC to the UFO)


Power doesn't necessarily matter 100% considering Switch players play 240p 30fps games anyway, but the use of an AMD APU could keep costs low and thermals manageable.


I'd market this device as a complement to a gaming PC, not necessarily as something 100% stand-alone. The ability to "dock" like the Switch should be a priority. Utilize TB3 instead of USB-C (this would raise cost, but it's necessary), SD Card support (of course), and I'd like for Steam/Origin/uPlay/Battle.net to allow "low quality assets only" downloads to keep file sizes low.


But that's just me.
snippet.textOriginal:
This would be great! But it has to be at a reasonable price range, good battery life, and strong Wi-Fi antenna (considering a lot of PC gamers are probably going to use this, they can stream gameplay from their PC to the UFO)


Power doesn't necessarily matter 100% considering Switch players play 240p 30fps games anyway, but the use of an AMD APU could keep costs low and thermals manageable.


I'd market this device as a complement to a gaming PC, not necessarily as something 100% stand-alone. The ability to "dock" like the Switch should be a priority. Utilize TB3 instead of USB-C (this would raise cost, but it's necessary), SD Card support (of course), and I'd like for Steam/Origin/uPlay/Battle.net to allow "low quality assets only" downloads to keep file sizes low.


But that's just me.

snippet.textDisplay:
feedback for the project UFO:
- comes with a mobile version of discrete GPUs like 1660ti/MX 250 or equivalent would be nice

- otherwise, put the latest and greatest Ryzen APUs, not intel. everyone knows Ryzen APUs is the best.
- or consumer can choose between intel iGPU or amd APUs
- high end speakers
- high end screen tech (freesync/gysnc?) to eliminate latency and screen tears
- able to dock it with an external GPU and play on my cousins' TVs so i can flex my new "PC Switch"
- don't put a ridiculous screen res like 4K res, it only slows down the device. we want more framerates! (most igpu can play all games above 30/60fps depending on the game at medium high settings if the screen is 720p res)
- 3.5 mm audio jack
- sim card support
- upgradable storage drives (nvme m.2 drive?)
- sd card support
- bluetooth / external controller support
- high end gyroscope module for accuracy
- lite and pro version (better hardware)
- high end wifi module for those LAN parties
- more color variant (black/pink/turqoise etc)for my edgy innerself
- and lastly, of course put a reasonable price tag, we will pay for the hardware crammed inside not the branding


thats all i can think right now
snippet.textOriginal:
feedback for the project UFO:
- comes with a mobile version of discrete GPUs like 1660ti/MX 250 or equivalent would be nice

- otherwise, put the latest and greatest Ryzen APUs, not intel. everyone knows Ryzen APUs is the best.
- or consumer can choose between intel iGPU or amd APUs
- high end speakers 
- high end screen tech (freesync/gysnc?) to eliminate latency and screen tears
- able to dock it with an external GPU and play on my cousins' TVs so i can flex my new "PC Switch"
- don't put a ridiculous screen res like 4K res, it only slows down the device. we want more framerates! (most igpu can play all games above 30/60fps depending on the game at medium high settings if the screen is 720p res)
- 3.5 mm audio jack
- sim card support 
- upgradable storage drives (nvme m.2 drive?)
- sd card support
- bluetooth / external controller support 
- high end gyroscope module for accuracy
- lite and pro version (better hardware)
- high end wifi module for those LAN parties
- more color variant (black/pink/turqoise etc)for my edgy innerself
- and lastly, of course put a reasonable price tag, we will pay for the hardware crammed inside not the branding

snippet.textDisplay:
I would have two "recommendations" for project UFO.
1.: I admit, I don't know which processor is inside this thing but if it is one with the old Intel iGPU and not Intels new Xe graphics, I would recommend to use an AMD APU because they have better GPUs inside
2.: I wouldn't price it to high if Dell wishes to have a Switch competitor

I hope they listen to this and make project UFO great!
